actionUnits.condition: Directly invoke public no-parameter methods on MonoBehaviour (GvrTooltip) to validate configuration. Note: Object has no Collider/Rigidbody/EventTrigger, so this requires test harness-level method invocation. Script GUID: 7c52851ea0de74a228fa29a84de008ba, component fileID: 950. Scene config: location=3 (AppButtonInside), alwaysVisible=false.

Evaluate handedness-dependent side selection by invoking public method. Requires ability to set/read GvrSettings.Handedness at runtime or provide two runs: Right and Left. Expectation: with location=AppButtonInside, IsTooltipOnLeft() returns true when Right-handed, false when Left-handed.

MonoBehaviour (fileID: 929, guid: 7c52851ea0de74a228fa29a84de008ba) is GvrTooltip with serialized settings: location=2 (AppButtonOutside), text.fileID=1013, alwaysVisible=false. Objective: invoke parameterless public methods to exercise logic paths that don't require runtime GvrArmModel signals. Note: This GameObject has no Rigidbody/Collider/EventTrigger in provided data; direct method calls are used for coverage. Also need confirmation if any interactable events (m_Calls) exist—none shown here.

MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 973) is GvrAudioSource (script guid: 6dbca64e524ea44f9b26142ec59aca8a) attached to GameObject 'ButtonClickSound' (fileID: 202). Scene settings match script fields: playOnAwake=0, sourceClip guid=ec4642a7ec8557245a62d08bb0076fd9, loop=0, volume=1, pitch=1, priority=128, rolloffMode=Logarithmic, minDistance=1, maxDistance=500, hrtfEnabled=1, occlusionEnabled=0. No m_Calls (UnityEvent) bindings present; manual trigger required to start playback.
After starting playback, pause to validate Pause() path and isPaused flag transitions.
Resume playback to validate UnPause() behavior and state updates.
Stop playback to validate Stop() path, ShutdownSource(), and state reset.

MonoBehaviour id=944 uses script guid=6dbca64e524ea44f9b26142ec59aca8a (GvrAudioSource). Config: playOnAwake=0, sourceClip guid=3b1bac9d0cdfad24e9ffb75aa75e4f96 assigned, loop=0, mute=0, volume=1, rolloff=Logarithmic, hrtfEnabled=1, occlusionEnabled=0. No Collider/Rigidbody/EventTrigger present; manual method trigger needed to begin playback and exercise InitializeSource/Update paths.
While clip is playing, pause to set isPaused=true and audioSource.Pause(); verify Update handles paused state.
Resume from paused state to cover UnPause() branch and resume Update with playing state.
Stop playback to exercise Stop() and ShutdownSource() paths (ZeroOutput, spatialize=false, DestroyAudioSource).
Restart playback after Stop() to validate re-initialization via InitializeSource() and re-binding spatializer parameters.
Final Stop to ensure clean shutdown state.

Verification-only placeholder: Canvas (fileID:97) has MonoBehaviour id:927 using script guid:739800cd36aba44e9b04ce977e5784bd (GvrPointerGraphicRaycaster). To achieve code coverage for Raycast(), we need info on GvrPointerManager.Pointer presence, a world-space Canvas renderMode, and any interactive child Graphics to receive hits.

MonoBehaviour (script guid: ddd25f1308577456cbaa207901961126, component fileID: 972) attached to GameObject 'DemoInputManager' (fileID: 197). No Collider/Rigidbody/EventTrigger present; no m_Calls UnityEvents defined in scene meta. Expect these to read PlayerSettings VR SDKs and return a bool; no side effects.

GameObject 'default' (id: 264, tag: 'mirror') has EventTrigger (id: 994) mapping: eventID 0/1 -> Collectable.SetGazedAt(bool), eventID 4 -> Usable.Use(Inventory id: 985). Since pointer events and Inventory selection may not be driven in this test harness, manually invoke Usable.Inspect() (MonoBehaviour id: 996, script guid: 164fdbff0d3254b5691f0f3dddc50068) to validate default inspection behavior.

Usable (id: 996) dispatch UnityEvent has a persistent call to FindEscape.Escape() (id: 997, script guid: 039fb8407de0f43eea2f8c130a6df149). Normally this is invoked after EventTrigger eventID 4 calls Usable.Use(inv) with the correct item. To ensure coverage without relying on pointer events or inventory, manually trigger Escape() and verify it disables Usable/Collectable/Collider on the 'mirror' object, plays audio, destroys 'reflectionProbe', and stops background music.

GameObject 'default' (id: 277, tag: 'vase') has BoxCollider (id: 798) and EventTrigger (id: 1010). MonoBehaviour id: 1009 maps to Collectable (script guid: fd9b592feb7384d0a9c94749396c5a5e). MonoBehaviour id: 1011 maps to ReplaceFlower (script guid: b9a7c98e07a2a4348a8fa4e52d5fd6af). EventTrigger (id: 1010) delegates: eventID 0/1 -> Collectable.SetGazedAt(bool) on 1009, eventID 4 -> Usable.Use(Inventory id: 985) on component id: 1008 (Usable). ReplaceFlower.PlaceFlower() is not wired via m_Calls and must be triggered manually to exercise its logic: it enables the 'flower' object (id: 82, tag: 'flower'), updates the mirror's Usable.inspectMessage (mirror id: 264), and disables Collectable/Usable/Collider on the vase.

Invoke Collectable.Collect() on vase to cover Collectable’s no-parameter path. Scene settings: Collectable (id: 1009, guid: fd9b592feb7384d0a9c94749396c5a5e) has item: {fileID: 0} (null) and dispatch has no persistent calls. Expected: No item added, object not destroyed, and no dispatch effects.

GameObject 'default' (fileID: 57) has BoxCollider (id: 778) and attached scripts: Inspectable (id: 909, guid: 20f309bd30f854a1cb08cabddfbc74e5), MovePillow (id: 910, guid: 85f9854fdebef48de893bf8e6be7bb91), Collectable (id: 911, guid: fd9b592feb7384d0a9c94749396c5a5e). MovePillow.Start() disables Inspectable/Collectable/Collider, so pointer events won’t fire; manually call Collectable.Collect() to exercise Collectable and its UnityEvent dispatch (m_Calls: target=MovePillow id 910, method=MovePillowAway), which should move the pillow and enable the key collider.

Invoke Inspectable.Inspect() (id: 909, guid: 20f309bd30f854a1cb08cabddfbc74e5) to cover default observation text path. This method is parameterless and displays the configured message: 'This looks out of place...'.

GameObject 'default' (fileID: 27) under 'Furniture' has BoxCollider (id: 776) and MonoBehaviours: Collectable (id: 898, guid: fd9b592feb7384d0a9c94749396c5a5e), Inspectable (id: 899, guid: 20f309bd30f854a1cb08cabddfbc74e5), Lightable (id: 900, guid: 88bc783c768ce4eb29e7f2d95dc4f793). No Rigidbody present, so only Trigger actions are valid. First, invoke Inspectable.Inspect() to cover the default path (initial inspectMessage is empty; no UnityEvent m_Calls configured).
Toggle Lightable once to cover the 'on' branch: Lightable.ToggleLight() (id: 900) flips on=true, enables child Light, and sets Inspectable.inspectMessage to "That's much better...".
Call Inspectable.Inspect() again to exercise updated message path after Lightable turned on.
Toggle Lightable a second time to cover the 'off' branch: Lightable.ToggleLight() sets on=false, disables child Light, and updates Inspectable.inspectMessage to "Hello darkness, my old friend...".
Call Inspectable.Inspect() a third time to verify message path after Lightable turned off.

Invoke Collectable.Collect() (id: 898, guid: fd9b592f...) to cover collection path and UnityEvent dispatch; scene shows item is null and dispatch.m_Calls is empty, so no inventory addition or destruction is expected, but dispatch.Invoke() will execute safely.

DigitalClock2_LED (fileID: 138) has MonoBehaviour_0 id: 942 with m_Script guid: 21b908ce4d9cbc14489c84c042cae40b, which matches the provided DigitalClock script. Scene settings match the script: hoursDCV (fileID: 925), minutesDCV (fileID: 913), secondsDCV is null, pointsDCV (fileID: 943), pointFlicker = true, clockSpeed = 1. With secondsDCV null, Start() auto-runs PlayTime(), which waits 60/clockSpeed seconds, increments minutesDCV, and updates the Inspectable.inspectMessage on the GameObject tagged 'clock' (this object: 'default', fileID: 167, Inspectable id: 954). PlayPointFlicker() also runs automatically due to pointFlicker = true. This wait step ensures those automatic coroutines execute and set the dynamic message.

After DigitalClock2_LED (MonoBehaviour id: 942) updates Inspectable.inspectMessage on the object tagged 'clock', invoke Inspectable.Inspect() to surface the dynamically set text ('It reads HH:MM.') via SubtitlesCanvas/MessageText. Confirm MonoBehaviour_1 (id: 954) on 'default' uses script guid 20f309bd30f854a1cb08cabddfbc74e5 matching Inspectable. BoxCollider present (id: 784) makes manual Trigger valid.

MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 925) on GameObject 'Hours' (fileID: 92) uses m_Script guid 99d3f5635e2a2c94bba763a859e816ec (DigitalClockValue). Scene settings match the script fields: currentValue=0, maximumValue=24, NextValue=null (fileID: 0), tens=fileID 901 (non-null), units=fileID 1016 (non-null), tensValue=10, reverse=false. No Rigidbody or EventTrigger is present; this action directly invokes the public parameterless MonoBehaviour method to simulate a clock tick and to drive DisplaySelectedObject updates. Calls are repeated to cover normal increment and overflow wrap-around paths; NextValue remains null so cascade is not invoked.

MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 925) on GameObject 'Hours' (fileID: 92) uses m_Script guid 99d3f5635e2a2c94bba763a859e816ec, matching DigitalClockValue. Scene fields match: currentValue=0, maximumValue=24, NextValue=null, tens=fileID 901, units=fileID 1016, tensValue=10, reverse=false. Child 'LED Yellow Numbers' (fileID: 29) has MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 901) using m_Script guid 1bd5b4c54e111e240aa7b6088078e1f9, matching DisplaySelectedObject, with displayOptions[10], currentDisplay=0, temporalGOArrange=0, ButtonSelectable=false. Triggering DigitalClockValue.ChangeTimeValue() repeatedly will indirectly call DisplaySelectedObject.TurnSelectedWithButton(int) on both tens (fileID 901) and units (fileID 1016), covering: (a) OnEnable + TurnOffAll path already executed on load with temporalGOArrange=0, (b) TurnSelectedWithButton branch where curDisp == oldDisplay for early values, (c) branch where curDisp != oldDisplay when hours cross 10 (tens: 0→1) and 20 (tens: 1→2), and (d) wrap-around at 24→0. Note: To fully exercise TemporalMethodArrangeModels/TemporalPlaceArrangeModels, temporalGOArrange must be set to 1, which is not the current scene state. Also, please confirm a Collider/EventTrigger exists on 'Hours' (or grant permission to invoke script methods directly) to satisfy the Trigger action constraint.

On GameObject 'Hours' (fileID: 92), MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 925) uses m_Script guid 99d3f5635e2a2c94bba763a859e816ec, which matches DigitalClockValue. Scene fields match the script: currentValue=0, maximumValue=24, NextValue=null, tens=fileID 901, units=fileID 1016, tensValue=10, reverse=false. Child 'LED Yellow Numbers' (fileID: 293) has MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 1016) using m_Script guid 1bd5b4c54e111e240aa7b6088078e1f9, which matches DisplaySelectedObject. Its fields match: displayOptions[10], currentDisplay=0, temporalGOArrange=0, ButtonSelectable=false. OnEnable() and TurnOffAll() on DisplaySelectedObject run automatically on load. Manually invoking DigitalClockValue.ChangeTimeValue() exercises the clock increment path and indirectly calls DisplaySelectedObject.TurnSelectedWithButton(int) for units (fileID: 1016) and tens (fileID: 901). Repeating 24 times covers increments 0→23 and wrap-around to 0, ensuring units cycle 0–9 twice and tens transitions 0→1→2. Note: Hours does not show a Collider/Rigidbody/EventTrigger; please confirm permission to invoke MonoBehaviour methods directly for testing.

GameObject 'Minutes' (fileID: 65) has MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 913) using m_Script guid 99d3f5635e2a2c94bba763a859e816ec, which matches DigitalClockValue. Scene fields match the script: currentValue=0, maximumValue=60, NextValue=fileID 925 (the 'Hours' DigitalClockValue), tens=fileID 893, units=fileID 895, tensValue=10, reverse=false. Triggering ChangeTimeValue() repeatedly covers: (1) normal increment path; (2) DisplaySelectedObject updates via tens.TurnSelectedWithButton(currentValue/10) and units.TurnSelectedWithButton(currentValue%10); (3) wrap-around when currentValue > maximumValue-1 (i.e., from 59 to 0); and (4) cascade to NextValue.ChangeTimeValue() on the 'Hours' object when minutes overflow. DisplaySelectedObject.OnEnable() for referenced tens/units is executed automatically on enable (temporalGOArrange assumed 0).

MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 893) on 'LED Yellow Numbers' uses m_Script guid 1bd5b4c54e111e240aa7b6088078e1f9 (type 3), which exactly matches the provided DisplaySelectedObject script. Scene fields match the script: displayOptions has 10 entries, currentDisplay=0, temporalGOArrange=0, ButtonSelectable=false. This component has no public parameterless methods; OnEnable executes automatically. To achieve coverage of TurnSelectedWithButton(int), it must be invoked by another controller (e.g., its parent 'Minutes') or via UnityEvent m_Calls/Collider/EventTrigger. Please provide the 'Minutes' GameObject script/meta (especially any parameterless public methods like a clock-advance method) or any UnityEvent m_Calls/Collider on either object so we can add concrete triggers.

MonoBehaviour_0 (id: 895) on 'LED Yellow Numbers' uses m_Script guid 1bd5b4c54e111e240aa7b6088078e1f9 (type 3), which exactly matches the provided DisplaySelectedObject script. Scene fields match the script: displayOptions has 10 entries, currentDisplay=0, temporalGOArrange=0, ButtonSelectable=false. This component exposes no public parameterless methods (OnEnable is automatic; TurnSelectedWithButton(int) requires an int parameter), and no Collider/EventTrigger/m_Calls are present to bind or route events. Therefore, to achieve full code coverage (including TurnSelectedWithButton path and the temporalGOArrange==1 branch that calls TemporalMethodArrangeModels/TemporalPlaceArrangeModels), please provide: (1) the parent 'Minutes' GameObject scripts/meta (any method that drives digit changes); (2) any UnityEvent m_Calls, Collider, or EventTrigger on either 'Minutes' or this child; or (3) permission/instructions to toggle temporalGOArrange to 1 and to re-enable the component so OnEnable runs that path.

MonoBehaviour_0 (id: 943) on 'LEDPoint' uses m_Script guid 99d3f5635e2a2c94bba763a859e816ec (type 3), which corresponds to the provided DigitalClockValue script. Scene fields match the script: currentValue=0, maximumValue=2, NextValue=null, tens=null, units=fileID 923 (DisplaySelectedObject), tensValue=2, reverse=false. Trigger ChangeTimeValue three times to cover: (1) normal increment 0->1, units.TurnSelectedWithButton(1); (2) overflow 1->0 with wrap-around, units.TurnSelectedWithButton(0); (3) another increment 0->1, units.TurnSelectedWithButton(1). Tens path is null and NextValue is null, so those branches are not exercised with current scene settings.

LED Yellow Point (fileID: 84) has MonoBehaviour_0 id 923 using m_Script guid 1bd5b4c54e111e240aa7b6088078e1f9, which matches DisplaySelectedObject. Its fields match: displayOptions has 2 entries, currentDisplay=0, temporalGOArrange=0, ButtonSelectable=false. Parent LEDPoint (fileID: 148) has MonoBehaviour_0 id 943 using m_Script guid 99d3f5635e2a2c94bba763a859e816ec, which matches DigitalClockValue. Fields: currentValue=0, maximumValue=2, NextValue=null, tens=null, units=fileID 923 (the child DisplaySelectedObject), tensValue=2, reverse=false. OnEnable of DisplaySelectedObject runs automatically at scene load (turning off all options and activating index 0). To exercise DisplaySelectedObject.TurnSelectedWithButton via the bound DigitalClockValue.units reference and to cover wrap-around logic in DigitalClockValue.ChangeTimeValue, trigger ChangeTimeValue three times.

Auto-update path: Let GvrController (MonoBehaviour id: 949, guid: adde9bdea083943199c7959004756e60, emulatorConnectionMode=USB) run its EndOfFrame() coroutine, which invokes OnControllerUpdate each frame. GvrArmModel (MonoBehaviour id: 948, guid: 7dda4bb2d5509e44e978d2bf56e25d7c, followGaze=DuringMotion, useAccelerometer=false) listens to that event and executes OnControllerUpdate() -> ApplyArmModel(), UpdateTransparency(), UpdatePointer(). This requires no manual calls; we just wait one frame for the automatic events to fire.

Recenter path in GvrArmModel.OnControllerUpdate(): set GvrController.Recentered=true for one frame so GvrArmModel.ResetState() executes; also exercises UpdateTorsoDirection() with firstUpdate=true. Needs controller provider or test hook to simulate a recenter gesture or to set the state flag.

Disconnected state path in GvrArmModel.OnControllerUpdate(): set GvrController.State != Connected (e.g., Disconnected) to force ResetState() branch instead of UpdateFromController(). Requires controller provider hook to simulate connection state change.

Accelerometer path: toggle GvrArmModel.useAccelerometer=true at runtime and feed non-zero Accel/Gyro to exercise UpdateFromController(), UpdateVelocity(), TransformElbow() branches; also cover MIN_ACCEL gating and velocity/acceleration suppression code paths. Requires a way to modify the MonoBehaviour field or provide motion data through the controller provider; no public no-arg methods exist to toggle this via Trigger.

Gaze-following variations: change GvrArmModel.followGaze to Never and Always to cover UpdateTorsoDirection() branches (Never: early return; Always: direct set; DuringMotion: slerp using Gyro magnitude). Requires runtime access to the serialized field or alternate prefabs; no public no-arg methods are available.

Transparency/tooltip alpha paths: move wristPosition close to origin (< fadeDistanceFromFace) and beyond tooltipMinDistanceFromFace to exercise both fade-in and fade-out branches in UpdateTransparency(). This requires feeding controller orientation/pose data via the provider; cannot be done with Grab/Transform because the object lacks a Rigidbody/Collider.

Manually invoke Inventory.ToggleVisibility() to simulate GvrController.AppButtonUp and cover the 'show' branch. MonoBehaviour component id=985 is the Inventory script (m_Script guid=3652d147b24254c618ce4989e3b9003c, type=3) attached to GameObject fileID=94. Requires a CanvasGroup on the same GameObject to avoid NullReference.

Manually invoke Inventory.ToggleVisibility() again to cover the 'hide' branch and verify CanvasGroup.alpha toggles back and blocksRaycasts is reset. Same MonoBehaviour id=985 (guid=3652d147b24254c618ce4989e3b9003c).

Auto-run only: On scene load, MonoBehaviour(id=939, m_Script guid=6e888d82ad62a4fd99699eeee0553755) which corresponds to ShowMessage.Start() caches Text and parent CanvasGroup. No manual, no-parameter public methods are exposed. To exercise ShowMessage.ShowText coroutine, a UnityEvent (m_Calls) or other script must invoke ShowMessage.RunMessage(string).

MonoBehaviour id 926 maps to script GUID e7dcc90c2e60c4011896c7f21fc1f557 (GvrReticlePointer). Ensure it is enabled, then call its public no-arg API to register as the main pointer so downstream raycasters can detect the pointer.

MonoBehaviour id 926 in scene maps to script GUID e7dcc90c2e60c4011896c7f21fc1f557 (GvrReticlePointer). Ensure the component is enabled, then set this as the active Gvr pointer so downstream raycasters can function.

MonoBehaviour id 915 on ddcontroller maps to script GUID aa952cbcc0eb13d4ca558b6da550ff55 (class GvrControllerVisual) exactly matching the provided source code. Its serialized fields (touchPoint fileID 109; material_idle/app/system/touchpad; touchTransparent/touchOpaque) align with the scene meta. To achieve code coverage we need the GameObject/script providing GvrArmModel.Instance and a way to simulate GvrController state (ClickButton, AppButton, Recentering, IsTouching, TouchPos).

Call Tab.Open() on MonoBehaviour_1 (id: 904, guid: c2bcf79fd38b2441fa17fde42cfce34d). This should instantiate and enable the pagePrefab (guid: e749a5bf695bb464390eb1ffd27aba4f, fileID: 1905160441634000) since cachePage = false, and then use UIFadeTransition (MonoBehaviour_0 id: 903, guid: a4ab599ee1dbcea41b165ae5170d9f03) to TransitionIn with transitionInDelaySeconds = 0.1875 and durationSeconds = 0.25.

Manually invoke public no-arg methods on GvrTooltip (MonoBehaviour id: 892, script guid: 7c52851ea0de74a228fa29a84de008ba) to validate side/inside logic. IsTooltipOnLeft() -> depends on GvrSettings.Handedness: returns false for Right-handed (default), true for Left-handed.
